intro: Iria denutata, commonly known as the slender iria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Iria denutata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
